meanings.definition: To sell more of (something) than can be supplied or than exists
meanings.sent1: The store oversales the popular toy every holiday season.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes companies oversales their products, causing shortages.
meanings.sent3: The magician oversales his tricks to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: She oversales her enthusiasm for the new movie, making everyone want to see it.
meanings.sent5: The chef oversales the deliciousness of his signature dish, making it a must-try.

meanings.definition: The act of selling more of (something) than can be supplied or than exists
meanings.sent1: The oversales of concert tickets led to a chaotic situation at the venue.
meanings.sent2: The oversales of limited edition sneakers caused a frenzy among collectors.
meanings.sent3: The oversales of ice cream in winter made everyone laugh at the shop's mistake.
meanings.sent4: The oversales of the new book made it a bestseller overnight.
meanings.sent5: The oversales of the charity event tickets ensured a full house on the day of the event.
